Detailed Description

A plValues is an object storing the values of a set of variables.

Member Function Documentation

plValues plValues::add ( const plSymbol &  variable,
const plData &  value 
) const

Creates a new plValues object identical to this one, except that it binds a variable to a value.

The variable does not need to be already bound in the original object.

This is useful to build plValues objects inline. For example:

std::cout << question.instantiate(plValues().add(a, 42).add(b, 66)).compile() << std::endl;
plVariablesConjunction plValues::get_variables ( ) const
inline

Returns the corresponding variable conjunction.

bool plValues::is_empty ( ) const
inline

Return true if default-constructed.

bool plValues::is_valid ( ) const

Return true iff the object is fully initialized (non-empty) or the current values are compatible with the types of the variable conjunction.

plValues plValues::operator^ ( plValues const &  other) const

"a ^ b" returns a new plValues object binding the union of variables of plValues a and b, with values as specified by a and b.

If a variable is bound in both a and b, the value in b is kept.

plValues& plValues::operator^= ( plValues const &  other)

"a ^= b" sets "a" to the binding of the union of variables of plValues a and b, with values as specified by a and b.

If a variable is bound in both a and b, the value in b is kept.

void plValues::Output ( std::ostream &  out) const
protectedvirtual

Writes the object at the out stream.

Implements plObject.

void plValues::set_partially ( const plValues &  partial_value)

Set partially the value.

partial_value variables are supposed to be a subset of this value variables

plFloat plValues::support_area ( ) const

Returns the support area of this value.

The support area for an interval variable is the size of the current interval. For any value of any other variable, the support area is always 1. For a conjunction of variables, the support area is the product of support areas for each variable in the conjunction.
